Header: Mullaittivu Troops Join ‘Sahasak Nimevun’ Innovation Exhibition - 2018
Content: The ‘Innoveta’ educational and creative exhibition, ‘Sahasak Nimevun’ of the Security Force Headquarters - Mullaittivu (SFHQ-MLT) that mirrors exclusive innovative talents of the troops was opened to members of the Security Forces on Wednesday (6) inside the SFHQ-MLT grounds on the instructions of Major General Dushyantha Rajaguru, Commander, Security Forces - Mullaittivu (SF-MLT). The ‘Sahasak Nimevun’ innovation exhibition which consisted of 35 creative products of Mullaittivu-based soldiers was opened by Major General Dushyantha Rajaguru, Commander, SF-MLT, together with several Senior Officers after lighting the traditional oil lamp as the Chief Guest for the occasion. Major General K.R.P Rowel (Rtd), Director General, Research Analysis Projection and Development Branch was also present at the occasion. This exhibition provides a rare opportunity for the troops to enhance their knowledge and grasp the idea of innovative thinking and creative values. Three exceptional innovations at Mullaittivu were awarded prizes and certificates. All 35 innovators were gifted with cash incentives as symbols of appreciation. Senior lecturers of the Rajarata University, Dr Pubudu Darshana of the Faculty of Applied Science and Dr G.A.C Ginigandara of the Faculty of Agriculture also attended as members of the observation committee, together with several Army Officers of Research Analysis Projection and Development Branch of the Army Headquarters.
